articles.author: David Brunnstrom, Simon Lewis
articles.description: The United States will veto a U.N. Security Council resolution for a ceasefire in Israel's war in Gaza if it is brought to a vote in its current form, a senior U.S. official said on Wednesday, accusing council members of cynically rejecting attempts at reaching a compromise.
articles.title: US will veto UN Security Council resolution on Gaza war in its current form, says official

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Vladimir Putin is open to discussing a Ukraine ceasefire deal with Donald Trump but rules out making any major territorial concessions and insists Kyiv abandon ambitions to join NATO, five sources with knowledge of Kremlin thinking told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Putin, ascendant in Ukraine, eyes contours of a Trump peace deal

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Tom Balmforth, Max Hunder
articles.description: Ukraine fired a volley of British Storm Shadow cruise missiles into Russia on Wednesday, the latest new Western weapon it has been permitted to use on Russian targets a day after it fired U.S. ATACMS missiles.
articles.title: Ukraine fires UK Storm Shadow cruise missiles into Russia, a day after using US ATACMS

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Tanks deepened their incursion and blew up homes, according to residents.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 15 in Gaza as hospital in north of the region makes distress call

articles.author: Camillus Eboh
articles.description: At least 50 Boko Haram fighters were killed on Tuesday and seven members of Nigeria's infrastructure security force were missing following an insurgent ambush on a convoy monitoring the country's power grid installations, a spokesperson said.
articles.title: At least 50 insurgents killed, seven Nigerian officers missing after convoy attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hezbollah chief Naim Qassem said in a televised speech aired on Wednesday that his group had reviewed and given feedback on a U.S.-drafted ceasefire proposal to end fighting with Israel, and that a halt to hostilities was now in Israel's hands.
articles.title: Hezbollah chief says it reviewed truce proposal, ceasefire in Israel's hands

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: U.N. nuclear watchdog chief Rafael Grossi said on Wednesday he hopes Iran's move towards capping its stock of uranium just short of weapons grade will hold, as his agency's board was set to pass a Western-drafted resolution that could derail that.
articles.title: IAEA's Grossi hopes Iran's capping of highly enriched uranium stock holds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Serbian opposition politicians scuffled with police as they blocked entry to a court building on Wednesday in protest at the time it is taking to bring those responsible for a deadly train station roof collapse this month to justice.
articles.title: Serbian opposition politicians join protests after train station disaster

articles.author: James Pomfret, Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon Jimmy Lai on Wednesday testified in court for the first time in his years-long national security legal battle on charges of conspiracy to collude with foreign forces, and publishing seditious materials.
articles.title: Hong Kong pro-democracy tycoon Lai testifies in national security trial

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: The United States shut its embassy in Kyiv on Wednesday morning due to "specific information of a potential significant air attack" amid jitters in the capital over possible Russian retaliation a day after a big Ukrainian strike.
articles.title: US shuts Kyiv embassy due to 'potential significant air attack'
